ABDICATED.Defintion: If a king or queen abdicates, he or she makes a formal statement that he or she no longer wants to be king or queen

ABOLISH.Defintion: to end an activity or custom officially

APPOINT.Defintion: to choose someone officially for a job or responsibility

ASSUMING.Defintion: to accept something to be TRUE without question or proof

BLAND.Defintion: not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy

BLEND INTO THE BACKGROUND.Defintion: to be invisible against one's surroundings

BRANDS.Defintion: a type of product made by a particular company

BROOCH.Defintion: a small piece of jewellery with a pin at the back that is fastened to a woman's clothes

CEREMONIAL.Defintion: related to, used in, or involving a ceremony (= a fixed set of formal acts performed on important social or religious occasions)

COLLECTIVE.Defintion: of or shared by every member of a group of people

CONTINUITY.Defintion: the fact of something continuing for a long period of time without being changed or stopped

CONTRADICTORY.Defintion: If two or more facts, pieces of advice, etc. are contradictory, they are very different from each other

DIALOGUE.Defintion: conversation that is written for a book, play, or film

DISPUTE.Defintion: to disagree with something that someone says

DUTIES.Defintion: things that you have to do because it is part of your job, or that you feel is the right thing to do

EXECUTED.Defintion: to kill someone as a legal punishment

FLIRTATION.Defintion: a situation in which someone behaves as if sexually attracted to another person, without being seriously interested

GOT RID OF.Defintion: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person

IN LINE TO THE THRONE.Defintion: to be the person who will become king or queen after the present ruler

IN THE PUBLIC EYE.Defintion: to be famous and written about in newspapers and magazines and seen on television

KEEP YOUR EYES PEELED.Defintion: to watch carefully for someone or something

MERIT.Defintion: the quality of being good and deserving praise

MONARCHIC.Defintion: relating to or suitable for a king or queen, or relating to a monarchy

MONARCHIES.Defintion: a country that has a king or queen

MONARCHY.Defintion: a country that has a king or queen

NEUTRAL.Defintion: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war

PATRONS.Defintion: a person or group that supports an activity or organisation, especially by giving money

PROPORTION.Defintion: the number or amount of a group or part of something when compared to the whole

PUTTING A FOOT OUT OF LINE.Defintion: doing something that you should not do or to behave in an unacceptable way

QUOTED.Defintion: to repeat the words or ideas that someone else has said or written

REIGNED.Defintion: to be the king or queen of a country

REPUBLICANISM.Defintion: belief in or support for government by elected representatives of the people, rather than government by a king or queen

SCANDAL.Defintion: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

SMALL TALK.Defintion: conversation about things that are not important, often between people who do not know each other well

SO BE IT.Defintion: used to say that it is necessary to accept the situation as it exists

SPECULATION.Defintion: the activity of guessing possible answers to a question without having enough information to be certain

SPLIT.Defintion: to (cause to) divide into two or more parts, especially along a particular line

STICKS ITS NECK OUT.Defintion: To personally assume or expose oneself to some risk, danger, or responsibility; to imperil oneself or put oneself in harm's way

SUSPICION.Defintion: a belief or idea that something may be TRUE

TACTIC.Defintion: a planned way of doing something

THE CHANNEL.Defintion: the area of sea that separates England from France

TOLERATE.Defintion: to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with or approve of them

TRACK RECORD.Defintion: all the achievements or failures that someone or something has had in the past

TURF OUT.Defintion: to force someone to leave a place or an organisation

UNELECTED.Defintion: not having been voted into a particular important job or position

UNITY.Defintion: the state of being joined together or in agreement

VALID.Defintion: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted
